videos.title: Vermont Overland Grand Prix downtown Woodstock Village start/finish
videos.description: Peter Vollers gives an overview of the very European VOGP downtown Woodstock Village start and finish.
videos.transcript:
hi folks Peter vollers here from Vermont
Overland I just wanted AI thought it
would be helpful if we showed one of the
really cool aspects of Vermont overland
Grand Prix which is our Woodstock
village downtown start and finish so I'm
going to grab the camera and we come
back and show you some of the stuff we
have on this big whiteboard here this
big blown up version of the village
highway map so just you know what to
expect you'll be coming into town most
people will be coming in by root for
coming from coming from the east are
going to come in you're going to park on
these village streets and stuff we do
have some designated parking as you come
in but generally just find a place as
close as you can to the course on the
this you know the village is yours for
the day we will have other people coming
and visiting but just find a place to
park on any of these streets right here
then what you're going to do is
hopefully and actually if you're staying
here even better because you can just

for the day which is pretty
groundbreaking here in the village and
the start-finish is going to be right at
the base of high street and central
which is right there what we're going to
do in the morning nine o'clock go Oh
faster riders should line up in the

that start go out by the Rockefeller

you're off and running on the epic 53

road and which is these ancient
unmaintained roads in Vermont which is
just the most unique thing about the
race um just incredible but but here's
the deal if you do this race for no
other reason do it for the finish the
finish is incredible I subject be back
here because um I need to show you
that's all this blue stuff the finish
you're going to come sweeping into the
village and if you
on youtube I have a video with Brennan
rim or he is doing most of this
finishing circuit on just an awesome
video and it shows you how epic it is
you come back into town and you come
right in front of Woodstock and you go
around our little green here you enter
into the closed area on central street
you're going to make an abrupt right
turn onto mechanic street which is this
tiny little alleyway brick walls
incredibly European incredibly cool this
is where it starts to the cyclocross
guys come into the realms it's going to
be super tight very abrupt and if you're
with anybody you're going to want to
start jockeying for position because
you're going to go around the comfort
station which is our public restrooms on
this little parking lot in this back
alley then you're going to come into
you're going to go come into this
footbridge section the footbridge is
this wide so it's almost like a whole
shot you're going to you're going to be
vying for that whole shot and I'll tell
you why in a second because once you get
across the footbridge you're going to
pop up on the high street and then
you're going to immediately be setting
up for the final section of Vermont pave
Doubleday hill
holy hill is this incredible hell in
fact I'm looking out the window at it
right now that is eighteen percent grade
maybe twenty percent grade in another
part it's got a little bit of payment in
the beginning but then the rest of his
grass and dirt it's kind of some roughs
and stuff it is just the coolest thing
but it is all there the nice thing about
that is that whether you're there vying

of people cheering you on and doubled a
hill because it's literally 200 feet
away from the start finish so people can

terrorists but the cool thing about it
is even if you get gap thanh double date
hill you're going to still have time on
slate and terrorist if you've got just
about a little less than a kilometre to
the finish you're going to be able to
get by anybody or catching buddy who may

certainly get over the top of somebody
on Lincoln Street and then you're going
to come slamming down the once you're

for the line at that point we're going
to have Adam Adam sites of international

sponsors will be on both sides on the

are going to feel like you're in a

amazing so please get in on this because
it's just going to be a huge deal for
monoplane Grand Prix Peter baller
signing off

videos.title: Vermont Overland Grand Prix 2015 - Available in HD!
videos.description:
On Sunday, August 23rd, 2015, JOM of the Gravel Cyclist attended the Vermont Overland Grand Prix in Woodstock, Vermont, but technically in just-around-the-corner South Pomfret - at the Suicide Six ski resort, and location of the first ski lift in the Eastern United States - this is the ride / race video.

Gravel Cyclist Vermont Overland Grand Prix Ride / Race Report - http://wp.me/p4V4se-1EN

Blog: GravelCyclist.com
Facebook.com/GravelCyclist
Vimeo.com/GravelCyclist
Instagram/GravelCyclist

videos.title: Vermont Mountain Bike Gravel Ride - Woodstock Pomfret Quechee 4K
videos.description:
Riding along some of the most beautiful country roads the Northeast has to offer just north of Woodstock Vermont amidst the Green Mountains. 

Woodstock, Pomfret, Quechee Loop.

https://ridewithgps.com/routes/34308596

Instagram: @seanmauceri

GoPro 7 Black 
4k
Adobe Premiere Pro
24fps
Hyper-stabilization
Chest Mount 

Carver Titanium 29er Hardtail

videos.title: 2106 Vermont Overlander Bike Race
videos.description:
Footage of riders coming down Allen Hill Road into East Barnard VT.  Nothing great but maybe you'll see yourself. 

Photos of the 2016 race can be seen at: https://topshots.smugmug.com/2016/Vermont-Overlander-2016/

Photos of the 2015 race:
https://topshots.smugmug.com/2015/Vermont-Overland-Bike-Race/

videos.title: Race to the Top of Vermont: Dirty Gaps - an Epic Gravel Bike Adventure
videos.description:
Early in 2020, we registered for the Race to the Top of Vermont. It's Vermont's most famous hill climb, which ascends to the summit of Mount Mansfield, the Green Mountain State's highest peak. Alas, 2020 had other plans. Luckily, the folks behind the race, which benefits the Catamount Trail Association, came up with a clever and exciting alternative. Participants would ride on their own and log elevation gain.  They would have 36 hours to log as much gain as they can.  The most gain wins. 

Challenge accepted.

This is a ride which tested every aspect of our abilities, both mentally and physically.  It took us to the brink of our limits and tested the resilience of our friendship. We covered terrain that was challenging, bizarre, epic and simply a bad idea. And we loved every minute of it.

The only way to do this, for us, was to do it on gravel as much as possible, and to go places we'd never been. Vermont's "gaps," or mountain passes, were the obvious targets, but we'd have to hit the less popular ones, the ones that weren't as easy as hopping on a carbon-fiber climbing bike, putting your head down and pushing watts. That meant our targets were Waitsfield Gap, Moretown Gap, Roxbury Gap and Braintree Gap.  Waitsfield and Braintree in particular were "roads" only by the broadest definition of the term. Crossing them would present more challenges than any regular asphalt road could even think to conjure. 

And then there were the unexpected challenges, which we never saw coming. The Class IV roads (a Vermont term -- perhaps you know them more as "jeep trails" at best) which devolved into untamed forest. River crossings. Feral pigs. Road closures. The Northfield Pigman. Too much to fit in a video of any reasonable length.

We came out the other side. In what condition and with what success, you'll need to watch these 12 minutes to find out.  We appreciate you taking the time to share the experience with us.  We hope you'll stick around for more such adventures.  There are always more on the way.

-- Steve & Phil

Support the Catamount Trail Association: http://www.catamounttrail.org

Race website: http://www.rtttovt.com

Our website: https://www.greenmountaingravel.com
Our other website: https://www.graveldads.com

Additional photography and support provided by Jim & Billie Maas. Visit Jim's website at http://www.birdsinwood.com 

What we ride/use (no paid endorsements, we just love 'em):
Orbea Terra, Trek Bicycle Checkpoint
Fuel by Honey Stinger
Gloves by Handup Gloves
Computers by Wahoo Fitness
Rims by Astral Cycling and Mavic
Glasses by ROKA and Tifosi

#racetothetopvt #gravelbike #vermont #hshive #handupgloves
